item.title: According to the Mtgox leaks from early 2014, our brand new 'Satoshi' Craig Wright bought 17.24 bitcoins at a rate of $1198 each. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
According to the Mtgox leaks from early 2014, our brand new 'Satoshi' Craig Wright bought 17.24 bitcoins at a rate of $1198 each. * /r/Bitcoin

Bitcoin is the currency of the Internet: a distributed, worldwide, decentralized digital money. Unlike traditional currencies such as dollars, bitcoins are issued and managed without any central authority whatsoever: there is no government, company, or bank in charge of Bitcoin. As such, it is more resistant to wild inflation and corrupt banks.

item.title: Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - ETH Buyers Be Careful - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - ETH Buyers Be Careful - NEWSBTC

Ethereum price looks like setting up for a minor downside move. A break and close below the 100 hourly SMA may ignite a reaction. Ethereum price looks like setting up for a minor downside move. A break and close below the 100 hourly SMA may ignite a reaction.

item.title: Node40 streamlines blockchain network incentivization
item.description:
Node40 streamlines blockchain network incentivization

Like most tales of birth, this story too begins over dinner. It was the start of 2015. Sean Ryan, 35, a New York software developer sat down for dinner with Perry Woodin, 42, New York web developer, app creator, cryptocurrency enthusiast and investor.

item.title: UK Law Enforcement Sources Hint At Impending Craig Wright Arrest
item.description:
UK Law Enforcement Sources Hint At Impending Craig Wright Arrest

With all of the discussion regarding Craig Wright these days, the rest of the world is looking at this news with raised eyebrows. In fact, the UK government has not taken kindly to his "revelation", as Wright might be facing jail time for outing himself as Satoshi Nakamoto.

item.title: Bitcoin: Craig Wright promises new evidence to prove identity
item.description:
Bitcoin: Craig Wright promises new evidence to prove identity

Craig Wright, the Australian computer scientist who claims to have created the cryptocurrency bitcoin in 2008 under the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto, has promised to provide fresh evidence to back up his claim.

item.title: Chinese Investors Can Buy DigixDAO DGD Tokens At Yunbi
item.description:
Chinese Investors Can Buy DigixDAO DGD Tokens At Yunbi

Now that the DigixDAO initiative has been getting a lot of attention as of late, various exchanges are looking to sell the DGD token on their exchange. Yunbi, a Chinese cryptocurrency exchange, is one of the first opening a DGD/CNY trading pair.

item.title: Cash, Plastic or Bitcoin?
item.description:
Cash, Plastic or Bitcoin?

When he encountered the Great Khan's paper money in China around 1260, explorer Marco Polo was astonished at the ready acceptance of what we now call "fiat money," i.e. currency established by the government (from Latin "fiat" = it shall be).

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's on this Morning - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's on this Morning - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking to trade in the bitcoin price during this morning's European session. It's getting to the end of the week, and so far we've had plenty to talk about as far as action in the bitcoin price is concerned.

item.title: Coinsource Adds 9 Bitcoin ATMs In Los Angeles And Las Vegas
item.description:
Coinsource Adds 9 Bitcoin ATMs In Los Angeles And Las Vegas

Coinsource has added nine bitcoin ATMs in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, making it the largest ATM network on the West Coast. The installations mark the company's largest single rollout. The expansion into Los Angeles will benefit bitcoin enthusiasts in Southern California, according to Sheffield Clark, company CEO and co-founder.

item.title: Financial Players Fail To Create Global Use Cases For Blockchain Technology
item.description:
Financial Players Fail To Create Global Use Cases For Blockchain Technology

Depending on how much credit one wants to give to mainstream media when it comes to Bitcoin and blockchain, all institutions are steering away from cryptocurrency as of late. This seems a rather strange train of thought, considering no bank has ever embraced Bitcoin officially.
